file.name: emMon_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied,, including but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: mrsol
field.variable: Total water content of soil layer

field.name: fNfert
field.variable: relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area
total N added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure)

field.name: fNgas
field.variable: Total Nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)

field.name: fHarvestToProduct
field.variable: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here
Harvested biomass that goes into product pool

field.name: fNleach
field.variable: Total N loss to leaching or runoff (sum of ammonium, nitrite and nitrate)

field.name: fAnthDisturb
field.variable: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases carbon to the atmosphere instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...
carbon mass flux into atmosphere due to any human activity

field.name: mrsfl
field.variable: Frozen water content of soil layer

field.name: grassFrac_land
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

field.name: cLand
field.variable: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools

field.name: nProduct
field.variable: Nitrogen Mass in Products of Land Use Change

field.name: cSoilAbove1m
field.variable: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
Carbon mass in soil pool above 1m depth

field.name: mrsos_land
field.variable: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the soil layer.
Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column

field.name: netAtmosLandCO2Flux
field.variable: Net flux of CO2 between atmosphere and land (positive into land) as a result of all processes.

field.name: baresoilFrac
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by bare soil.

field.name: cSoil_land
field.variable: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.
Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool

field.name: treeFrac_land
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by trees.

field.name: fFireNat
field.variable: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO2 Emission from natural Fire

field.name: nLand
field.variable: Total nitrogen in all terrestrial nitrogen pools

field.name: fNdep
field.variable: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land
Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land

field.name: fCLandToOcean
field.variable: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
Lateral transfer of carbon out of gridcell that eventually goes into ocean

field.name: fNAnthDisturb
field.variable: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...
nitrogen mass flux out of land due to any human activity

field.name: nMineral
field.variable: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers

field.name: cSoilBelow1m
field.variable: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool below 1m Depth
Carbon Mass in Soil Pool below 1m Depth

field.name: cropFracC4
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

field.name: cropFracC3
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops

field.name: fNVegSoil
field.variable: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

field.name: fProductDecomp
field.variable: decomposition out of product pools to CO2 in atmos
decomposition out of product pools to CO2 in atmos

field.name: mrsll
field.variable: Liquid water content of soil layer

field.name: burntFractionAll
field.variable: Fraction of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic land use change
Fraction of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic land use change

field.name: fNLitterSoil
field.variable: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

field.name: fNnetmin
field.variable: Net nitrogen release from soil and litter as the outcome of nitrogen immobilisation and gross mineralisation

field.name: fNloss
field.variable: Not all models split losses into gasesous and leaching
Total N lost (including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and leaching)

field.name: fNVegLitter
field.variable: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

field.name: fDeforestToProduct
field.variable: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
Deforested biomass that goes into product pool as a result of anthropogenic land use change

field.name: fNup
field.variable: total plant nitrogen uptake (sum of ammonium and nitrate), irrespective of the source of nitrogen

field.name: fNProduct
field.variable: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it shoule be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
Deforested or harvested biomass as a result of anthropogenic land use or change

field.name: fNLandToOcean
field.variable: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
Lateral transfer of nitrogen out of gridcell that eventually goes into ocean

file.name: Amon_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied,, including but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: tauv
field.variable: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

field.name: rtmt
field.variable: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model : I.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model

field.name: clw
field.variable: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water

field.name: vas
field.variable: Northward component of the near surface wind

field.name: co2mass
field.variable: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

field.name: ccb
field.variable: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base

field.name: ts
field.variable: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

field.name: tasmax
field.variable: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: max")

field.name: prw
field.variable: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

field.name: prsn
field.variable: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

field.name: rsutcs
field.variable: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

field.name: fco2antt
field.variable: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs. Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2

field.name: cl
field.variable: Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.

field.name: rsdscs
field.variable: surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

field.name: cct
field.variable: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top

field.name: mc
field.variable: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components. The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.

field.name: tauu
field.variable: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

field.name: clt
field.variable: Total cloud area fraction for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

field.name: sci
field.variable: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs

field.name: tasmin
field.variable: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: min")

field.name: fco2fos
field.variable: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2

field.name: rsut
field.variable: at the top of the atmosphere

field.name: sbl
field.variable: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

field.name: rsdt
field.variable: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

field.name: wap
field.variable: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

field.name: fco2nat
field.variable: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid). This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land (nep) or ocean (fgco2) reservoirs.
Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources

field.name: pr
field.variable: includes both liquid and solid phases

field.name: tas
field.variable: tas diagnostic uses a special scheme in this simulation

field.name: co2mass
field.variable: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

field.name: rsds
field.variable: surface solar irradiance for UV calculations

field.name: ci
field.variable: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell.
Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell

field.name: cli
field.variable: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

field.name: hur
field.variable: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T 0 C, and with respect to ice for T0 C.

field.name: clivi
field.variable: Mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

field.name: clwvi
field.variable: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

field.name: uas
field.variable: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind

field.name: rlut
field.variable: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

field.name: ps
field.variable: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

field.name: evspsbl
field.variable: Evaporation at surface: flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

field.name: hurs
field.variable: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T 0 C, and with respect to ice for T0 C.

field.name: prc
field.variable: Convective precipitation at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

field.name: n2oglobal
field.variable: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O

field.name: n2oglobal
field.variable: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O

field.name: ch4global
field.variable: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

field.name: ch4global
field.variable: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

file.name: cfMon_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied,, including but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: albisccp_cloud
field.variable: ISCCP Mean Cloud Albedo. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction {:cltisccp} - see http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

field.name: cllcalipso
field.variable: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa

field.name: pctisccp_cloud
field.variable: ISCCP Mean Cloud Top Pressure. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction {:cltisccp} - see http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

field.name: clmcalipso
field.variable: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa

field.name: cltisccp
field.variable: Percentage total cloud cover, simulating ISCCP observations.

field.name: clcalipso
field.variable: Percentage cloud cover at CALIPSO standard heights.

field.name: clisccp
field.variable: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.
ISCCP Percentage Cloud Cover by Optical Depth Categories

field.name: clhcalipso
field.variable: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa

file.name: emDay_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied,, including but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: clwvic
field.variable: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

field.name: reffcclwtop
field.variable: Droplets are liquid only. This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.
Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius In Convective Cloud

field.name: ccldncl
field.variable: Droplets are liquid only. Report concentration 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops

field.name: scldncl
field.variable: Droplets are liquid only. Report concentration "as seen from space" over stratiform liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops

field.name: loadpoa
field.variable: Load of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter

field.name: loadoa
field.variable: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere_primary_organic_content and atmosphere_secondary_organic_content (see next two table entries).
Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter

field.name: loadsoa
field.variable: Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

field.name: clivic
field.variable: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

field.name: reffsclwtop
field.variable: Droplets are liquid only. This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over liquid stratiform cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.
Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius In Stratiform Cloud

field.name: mrsll
field.variable: Liquid water content of soil layer

field.name: mrsol
field.variable: Total water content of soil layer

field.name: mrsfl
field.variable: Frozen water content of soil layer

file.name: emYr_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%

CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: ra
field.variable: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land

field.name: rh
field.variable: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land

field.name: gpp
field.variable: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

file.name: emMonZ_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: noy
field.variable: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model); list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. NOy = N + NO + NO2 + NO3 + HNO3 + 2N2O5 + HNO4 + ClONO2 + BrONO2 Definition: Total reactive nitrogen; usually includes atomic nitrogen (N), nitric oxide (NO), NO2, nitrogen trioxide (NO3), dinitrogen radical (N2O5), nitric acid (HNO3), peroxynitric acid (HNO4), BrONO2, ClONO2 add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
Total reactive nitrogen volume mixing ratio

field.name: cly
field.variable: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
Total inorganic chlorine volume mixing ratio

field.name: bry
field.variable: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Bry = Br + BrO + HOBr + HBr + BrONO2 + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic bromine (e.g., HBr and inorganic bromine oxides and radicals (e.g., BrO, atomic bromine (Br), bromine nitrate (BrONO2)) resulting from degradation of bromine-containing organicsource gases (halons, methyl bromide, VSLS), and natural inorganic bromine sources (e.g., volcanoes, sea salt, and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
Total inorganic bromine volume mixing ratio

field.name: vt100
field.variable: Zonally averaged meridional heat flux at 100 hPa as monthly means derived from daily (or higher frequency) fields.

field.name: meanage
field.variable: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

file.name: cfDay_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied,, including but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: albisccp_cloud
field.variable: ISCCP Mean Cloud Albedo. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction {:cltisccp} - see http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

field.name: ccb
field.variable: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base

field.name: clhcalipso
field.variable: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa

field.name: rsut
field.variable: at the top of the atmosphere

field.name: clmcalipso
field.variable: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa

field.name: pctisccp_cloud
field.variable: ISCCP Mean Cloud Top Pressure. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction {:cltisccp} - see http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

field.name: rsdt
field.variable: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

field.name: clwvi
field.variable: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

field.name: cct
field.variable: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top

field.name: ps
field.variable: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

field.name: rsdscs
field.variable: surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

field.name: wap500
field.variable: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards) at 500 hPa level;

field.name: clivi
field.variable: Mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

field.name: cllcalipso
field.variable: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa

field.name: cltisccp
field.variable: Percentage total cloud cover, simulating ISCCP observations.

field.name: rsutcs
field.variable: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

file.name: Lmon_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied,, including but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: pastureFrac
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.
Percentage of Land which is Anthropogenic Pasture

field.name: mrlsl_land
field.variable: The mass of water in all phases, including ice, in soil layers. Report as missing for grid cells with no land.
Water Content per Unit Area of Soil Layers

field.name: cVeg_land
field.variable: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

field.name: burntArea
field.variable: Fraction of entire grid cell that is covered by burnt vegetation.

field.name: rh
field.variable: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land

field.name: mrsos_land
field.variable: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the soil layer.
Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column

field.name: fVegSoil
field.variable: Carbon mass flux per unit area from vegetation directly into soil, without intermediate conversion to litter.
Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

field.name: npp
field.variable: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land

field.name: cropFrac
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by crop.

field.name: cProduct_land
field.variable: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through landuse change.
Carbon Mass in Products of Landuse Change

field.name: fVegLitter
field.variable: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

field.name: residualFrac
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is land and is covered by neither vegetation nor bare-soil (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
Percentage of Grid Cell that is Land but Neither Vegetation-Covered nor Bare Soil

field.name: gpp
field.variable: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

field.name: fGrazing
field.variable: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to grazing on land
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Grazing on Land

field.name: fHarvest
field.variable: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to crop harvesting
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Crop Harvesting

field.name: mrro_land
field.variable: The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

field.name: fLitterSoil
field.variable: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).
Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

field.name: mrso
field.variable: the mass per unit area (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

field.name: fLuc_land
field.variable: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to human changes to land (excluding forest regrowth) accounting possibly for different time-scales related to fate of the wood, for example.
Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change

field.name: fFire
field.variable: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO2 Emission from Fire

field.name: mrros_land
field.variable: The total surface run off leaving the land portion of the grid cell (excluding drainage through the base of the soil model).

field.name: evspsblveg
field.variable: The canopy evaporation and sublimation (if present in model); may include dew formation as a negative flux.

field.name: tran_land
field.variable: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

field.name: treeFrac
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by trees.

field.name: nbp
field.variable: This is the net mass flux of carbon from atmosphere into land, calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbon fluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.
Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land

field.name: baresoilFrac
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by bare soil.

field.name: grassFrac
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

field.name: nep_land
field.variable: Natural flux of CO2 (expressed as a mass flux of carbon) from the atmosphere to the land calculated as the difference between uptake associated will photosynthesis and the release of CO2 from the sum of plant and soil respiration and fire. Positive flux is into the land. emissions from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land.

field.name: shrubFrac
field.variable: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by shrub.

field.name: ra
field.variable: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land

field.name: mrfso
field.variable: The mass per unit area (summed over all model layers) of frozen water.

file.name: LImon_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: snc
field.variable: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

field.name: snd
field.variable: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction). Reported as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

field.name: snw_land
field.variable: The mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

file.name: day_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: uas
field.variable: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind

field.name: sfcWindmax
field.variable: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

field.name: clt
field.variable: Total cloud area fraction for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

field.name: tasmax
field.variable: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: max")

field.name: prsn
field.variable: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

field.name: rlut
field.variable: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

field.name: tas
field.variable: tas diagnostic uses a special scheme in this simulation

field.name: prc
field.variable: Convective precipitation at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

field.name: tasmin
field.variable: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: min")

field.name: rhsmin
field.variable: Surface daily minimum of relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T 0 C, and with respect to ice for T0 C.

field.name: vas
field.variable: Northward component of the near surface wind

field.name: rhs
field.variable: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T 0 C, and with respect to ice for T0 C.

field.name: rsds
field.variable: surface solar irradiance for UV calculations

field.name: hur
field.variable: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T 0 C, and with respect to ice for T0 C.

field.name: pr
field.variable: includes both liquid and solid phases

field.name: rhsmax
field.variable: Surface daily maximum of relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T 0 C, and with respect to ice for T0 C.

field.name: wap
field.variable: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

field.name: mrsos_land
field.variable: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the soil layer.
Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column

field.name: tslsi
field.variable: "skin" temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.
Surface Temperature where Land or Sea Ice

field.name: mrro_land
field.variable: The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

field.name: mrso
field.variable: the mass per unit area (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

field.name: snw_land
field.variable: The mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

field.name: snc
field.variable: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

file.name: aermonthly_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: drynoy
field.variable: proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_all_nitrogen_oxides_due_to_dry_deposition. NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates. Dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition.

field.name: cdnc
field.variable: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration in liquid water clouds. Question: Is this rather a 3D field?

field.name: photo1d
field.variable: photolysis rate of O3 to O1d

field.name: mmrpm2p5
field.variable: PM2.5 mass mixing ratio at 50 percent RH

field.name: o3ste
field.variable: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone

field.name: swtoaasso4
field.variable: all sky sw-rf so4 at toa

field.name: reffclwtop
field.variable: Droplets are liquid only. This is the effective radius ""as seen from space"" over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere.TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from

field.name: lwtoaasaer
field.variable: all sky lw-rf aerosols at toa

field.name: od550lt1aer
field.variable: od550 due to particles with wet diameter less than 1 um (""ambient"" means ""wetted""). When models do not include explicit size information, it can be assumed that all anthropogenic aerosols and natural secondary aerosols have diameter less than 1 um.
ambient fine aerosol optical thickness at 550 nm

field.name: mcu
field.variable: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The atmosphere convective mass flux is the vertical transport of mass for a field of cumulus clouds or thermals, given by the product of air density and vertical velocity. For an area-average, cell_methods should specify whether the average is over all the area or the area of updrafts only.

field.name: airmass
field.variable: Vertically integrated mass content of air in layer
Vertically integrated mass content of air in layer

field.name: dryso2
field.variable: dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition

field.name: ztp
field.variable: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

field.name: lwtoaasdust
field.variable: all sky lw-rf dust at toa

field.name: nh50
field.variable: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (100ppbv), uniform fixed 50-day exponential decay.
Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (100ppbv), uniform fixed 50-day exponential decay.

field.name: emidms
field.variable: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

field.name: swtoaasss
field.variable: all sky sw-rf ss at toa

field.name: plev
field.variable: The atmospheric pressure at the model layer midpoints for all times and levels in the associated output variables

field.name: mmrpm1
field.variable: PM1.0 mass mixing ratio at 50 percent RH

field.name: emibvoc
field.variable: proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_biogenic_non_methane_volatile_organic_compounds_as_carbon_due_to_emission. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. _If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.
Total Emission Rate of biogenic nmvoc

field.name: emibc
field.variable: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
emission rate of black carbon aerosol mass

field.name: eminh3
field.variable: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

field.name: chepsoa
field.variable: Tendency of atmosphere mass content of secondary organic matter_dry aerosol due to net production: If model lumps SOA emissions with POA, then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as POA emissions. Here, mass refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. Instead of emi_soa in original ACCMIP Excel spreadsheet. That variable had notes: This can be a pseudo-emission flux as used in AEROCOM (Dentener et al, ACP, 2006) or the net. ""mass"" refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_secondary_particulate_organic_matter_dry_aerosol_due_to_net_chemical_production. Used instead of emi_asoa in original ACCMIP Excel spreadsheet. That variable had notes: This can be a pseudo-emission flux as used in AEROCOM (Dentener et al, ACP, 2006) or the net.
Production Rate of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

field.name: o3prod
field.variable: ONLY provide the sum of all the HO2/RO2 + NO reactions (as k*[HO2]*[NO])

field.name: wetnoy
field.variable: proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_all_nitrogen_oxides_due_to_wet_deposition. NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species, out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates.
wet deposition of noy incl aerosol nitrate

field.name: eminox
field.variable: NOx=NO+NO2. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

field.name: swtoaasbb
field.variable: all sky sw-rf bb at toa

field.name: swtoaasoaff
field.variable: all sky sw-rf oaff at toa anthropogenic

field.name: mmroa
field.variable: We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.

field.name: swtoacsbcff
field.variable: clear sky sw-rf bcff at toa

field.name: o3loss
field.variable: ONLY provide the sum of the following reactions: (i) O(1D)+H2O; (ii) O3+HO2; (iii) O3+OH; (iv) O3+alkenes (isoprene, ethene,etc)

field.name: tatp
field.variable: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

field.name: wetbc
field.variable: wet deposition rate of black carbon aerosol mass
wet deposition rate of black carbon aerosol mass

field.name: emico
field.variable: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

field.name: mmrpm10
field.variable: PM10 mass mixing ratio at 50 percent RH

field.name: pilev
field.variable: The atmospheric pressure at the model layer interfaces for all times and levels in the associated output variables

field.name: od440aer
field.variable: Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 440 nm
Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 440 nm

field.name: drynh4
field.variable: dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition

field.name: od870aer
field.variable: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water). Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types.
ambient aerosol optical thickness at 870 nm

field.name: dryss
field.variable: Dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition.

field.name: ccn
field.variable: Cloud Condensation Nuclei Concentration at Liquid Cloud Top

field.name: ptp
field.variable: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

field.name: emiso4
field.variable: expressed as a tendency of atmosphere mass content of SO4. Direct emission does not include secondary sulfate production. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_sulfate_dry_aerosol_due_to_emission. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
Total Direct Emission Rate of SO4

field.name: emilnox
field.variable: Integrate the NOx production for lightning over model layer. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_nox_from_lightning

field.name: dryoa
field.variable: Tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic dry aerosol due to dry deposition: This is the sum of dry deposition of POA and dry deposition of SOA (see next two entries). 'Mass' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Was called dry_pom in old ACCMIP Excel table. Dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition.
Dry Deposition Rate of dry aerosol total organic matter

field.name: dryo3
field.variable: dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition.

field.name: snc
field.variable: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

field.name: swtoacsdust
field.variable: clear sky sw-rf dust at toa

field.name: od550aer
field.variable: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water). Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"
Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 550 nm

field.name: emiaoa
field.variable: Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Tendency of atmosphere mass content of total organic aerosol due to emission: 'mass' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. Was called emi_apom in old ACCMIP Excel table. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
Anthropogenic Emission Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter

field.name: emioa
field.variable: tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic matter dry aerosol due to net production and emission. This is the sum of total emission of POA and total production of SOA (emipoa+chepsoa). ""Mass"" refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Was called emi_pom in old ACCMIP Excel table. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. ""mass"" refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. Was called emi_apom in old ACCMIP Excel table. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
rate of emission and production of dry aerosol total organic matter

field.name: drydust
field.variable: Dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition.

field.name: swtoacsaer
field.variable: clear sky sw-rf aerosols at toa

field.name: emiaco
field.variable: Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_carbon_monoxide_due_to_emission. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
Total Emission Rate of anthropogenic co

field.name: emivoc
field.variable: proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_non_methane_volatile_organic_compounds_as_carbon_due_to_emission. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. _If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.
Total Emission Rate of non-Methane Volatile Organic Compounds (NMVOC)

field.name: swtoaassoa
field.variable: all sky sw-rf soa at toa

field.name: wetoa
field.variable: tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic matter dry aerosols due to wet deposition: This is the sum of wet deposition of POA and wet deposition of SOA (see next two entries). ""Mass"" refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Was called wet_pom in old ACCMIP Excel spreadsheet.
wet deposition rate of dry aerosol total organic matter

field.name: emianox
field.variable: NOx=NO+NO2, Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_nox_expressed_as_nitrogen_due_to_emission. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

field.name: drynh3
field.variable: dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition

field.name: swtoaasaer
field.variable: all sky sw-rf aerosols at toa

field.name: emidust
field.variable: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

field.name: emiss
field.variable: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

field.name: lossn2o
field.variable: Annual Loss of atmospheric Nitrous Oxide

field.name: swtoacsoaff
field.variable: clear sky sw-rf oaff at toa anthropogenic

field.name: swtoaasno3
field.variable: all sky sw-rf no3 at toa

field.name: abs550aer
field.variable: Ambient Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550 nm
Ambient Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550 nm

field.name: swtoacsbb
field.variable: clear sky sw-rf bb at toa

field.name: emiisop
field.variable: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field

field.name: sic
field.variable: fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice.

field.name: swtoaasbcff
field.variable: all sky sw-rf bcff at toa anthropogenic

field.name: dryso4
field.variable: dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition

field.name: chepasoa
field.variable: If model lumps SOA emissions with POA, then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as POA emissions. 'mass' refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_anthropogenic_secondary_particulate_organic_matter_dry_aerosol_due_to_net_chemical_production. Used instead of emi_asoa in original ACCMIP Excel spreadsheet. That variable had notes: This can be a pseudo-emission flux as used in AEROCOM (Dentener et al, ACP, 2006) or the net.
Production Rate of Anthropogenic Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

field.name: convcl
field.variable: Convective cloud fraction in an atmospheric layer

field.name: swtoaasdust
field.variable: all sky sw-rf dust at toa

field.name: drybc
field.variable: Dry deposition includes gravitational settling, impact scavenging, and turbulent deposition.
Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

field.name: lwtoacsaer
field.variable: clear sky lw-rf aerosols at toa

field.name: aoanh
field.variable: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (0 ppbv), uniform fixed source (at all levels) everywhere else (source is unspecified but must be constant in space and time and documented). Note that the source could be 1yr/yr, so the tracer concentration provides mean age in years. For method using linearly increasing tracer include a method attribute: "linearly increasing tracer"For method using uniform source (1yr/yr) include a method attribute: "uniform source"

field.name: emiso2
field.variable: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
